results.title: Alternate interfaces

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

results.description: Stelarc’s Alternate Interfaces explores the human/machine divide.
description_for_label: Stelarc’s Alternate Interfaces explores the human/machine divide.

results.title: Prosthetic Head
results.brief_description: Prosthetic Head, is a computer-generated head that has real-time lip synching, speech synthesis, and facial expressions. Through a vision or sensor system, the Prosthetic Head will be able to acknowledge the presence and position of any physical body that approaches it and speak to the person who interrogates it.

results.title: The Archive project
results.brief_description:
Melbourne documentary filmmaker John Hughes will join ACMI as artist in residence in order to produce an exhibition, DVD, book and film program dedicated to the work of the Melbourne Realist Film Unit. The exhibition is scheduled for September 2004. REVISED: The Archive Project will be exhibited as part of 2006 Contemporary Commonwealth.

People involved with the Realist Film Unit made twelve films between 1946 and 1951. Some of these are lost. Those saved are held by Screen Sound Australia. These projects have received some attention in unpublished theses. However, the important work of the Melbourne realists remains largely ‘hidden history’ to a wider public.

John Hughes and/or ACMI may draw further finance for the production of the work, through ACMI, or independently through JH from grants. JH in collaboration with ACMI will seek partnerships in the project. JH will work from ACMI at Federation Square and participate in ACMI’s activities. He will also act as a mentor for ACMI staff.

results.title: Maidenhead
results.brief_description: Maidenhead is a series of chamber-fictions inhabited by a young woman named Alice. Linked in an oblique, dream like way, these short, sharp stories describe Alice’s survival in an everyday world of bizarre logic and strange emotions. It’s a place where miracles unfold in the bathroom and desire appears on a bus; where menacing joggers roam the suburbs and there’s something sinister about hats. Vibrant like musical, Maidenhead is at once funny and disquieting, poignant and absurd.

results.title: Orchestra of rust
results.brief_description: ‘Orchestra of rust’ is an installation based interactive that allows the user to create soundscapes and musical pieces via the medium of an entropic industrial environment. The user can explore a zone of decay within an old factory that contains a selection of obsolete machinery. Operating these machines creates particular sounds and corresponding animated sequences. Complex sound structures can be built up from turning on several machines at once. This provides access to other zones of the factory where remixes of the musical creations exist. Also included is extensive interactive information on the background of the machines and sounds, historical sources and concept rationale/hypothesis.

results.title: All Is full of love
results.brief_description: Chris Cunningham’s elegant film clip for Bjork’s All is full of love depicts the construction and subsequent desire between two intertwined robots. Designed by Cunningham himself, the two machines, whose faces bear more than a passing resemblance to Bjork sensually move in and around each other as a milky white fluid flows over their sexualised bodies.

results.title: Agora
results.brief_description: ‘Agora’ centres on the fear and panic of being lost in a crowded fairground, as a young girl befriends another lost boy hiding under a bus. The pair cleverly devise a strategy to make themselves seen as well as heard!
